name: Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan

reviews.title: Centraly located with a view
reviews.text: My stay was from Mar. 22-26 This hotel has great service with an amazing view and all this centraly located right in times square. The rooms were excellent, room service quick and kind. Very easy access to any place you might need to be.

Stayed here the weekend of March 24-26, 2006. Friend and I flew up to NYC to see "The Color Purple". This hotel is in the heart of everything you want to see and if you need a taxi, you can get one very easily. Our room was on the 45th floor and had 2 double beds, was a good size room, was very very clean, and had beds that rival the beds found at the Westin. Security here is excellent as no one gets on the elevators or escalators without showing room keys. Our room was beautiful and we had a beautiful view.
reviews.title: Great Location - Great Rooms

reviews.text: Also the hotel personnel was very very nice and accommodating.
reviews.title: Best of Broadway

reviews.text: Now for the negatives....the food at the hotel is way too expensive, even by NYC standards. The concierge is even more ridiculous. We were looking for some last minute Lion King Tickets and they told us they would start at $185 each. We called the theater directly and the price was $111 each. We also wanted to get a towncar to LaGuardia and the womon at the Concierge desk told me it would be $85 saying the service she uses has better insurance. I told her I would call someone else and asked for the number of another service with which I was familiar. She gave me the wrong number (not even close to the right number). Not saying she did it on purpose, but who knows. I did find the right number and the cost was $34.50, but I gave him $40. By the way, the name of the Limo service was CARMEL. They will pick you up at LGA and will also take appointments. They were very prompt and courteous. Other than those 2 points, everything else was great. Oh yeah, if you are looking for a great place for dinner, check out Blue Water Grill at Union Station. Will run you about $125 for dinner for 2, but very much well worth it. It's only about 10 mins from Crowne Plaza by taxi or town car. I will definitely stay at the Crowne Plaza in NYC again. I liked it so much I have booked the Crowne Plaza in San Francisco's Union Station. Enjoy your stay. By the way...The Color Purple was AWESOME!
reviews.title: Very pleased

reviews.text: I stayed at the Crowne Plaza from March 15-17th. The location is great for seeing Broadway shows, with a very short walk to most theaters. The lobby and check-in areas are nothing great, but the room I had on the 46th floor, the Club Floor, was excellent. The room was very quiet and was conducive to sleeping. Lots of little extras to help you get a good night's sleep including a thoughtful clip for the drapes to keep the light out, lavender spray for the sheets, ear plugs and an eye shade. They even include a cd on tips for sleeping. The bed, with a duvet, was very comfortable and I slept like a log both nights. The bathroom was large with lots of towels and terry robes. The Club Floor has a room that serves complimentary Continental breakfast. The first morning it was very good. The second morning, there was no coffee or knives for the butter and jams and the room was overcrowded. This was a let-down. But , all things considered, this is a very good hotel in a great location, and I'd stay here again.
reviews.title: Just what I needed...

reviews.text: It comes down to personal service with this hotel. There are spots of very good service and product at this hotel ... some of the best I have seen at 4 star level hotels; namely the bellhops and breakfast staff. Also, this hotel offers one of the best breakfasts you will get at this level of hotel. I enjoyed the bellhops they really do help you out. The Maids are very good too. The location is self explanatory -- it ROCKS! But it ends there. We were told by a staff member that the hotel has contracted out its concierge service and I left asking myself -- why even have them? We showed up at the concierge desk at 10 minutes before 8 am and noticed that the person on duty was behind the counter. He abruptly told us, before we even had a chance to say good morning, that he would not 'open' until 8 am. We went back at 8 and asked him for directions in using the metro -- which he told us just to walk and not bother with the metro; and when I told him of a problem with my coffee maker, he told me to call room maintenance. When I cast a puzzled look back at him, he promptly made the call for me. However, later that night, I noticed that noone had come and fixed my coffee pot and had to recall maintenance. On another occasion, with another concierge, I had a problem with the business center -- and the concierge told me to take the problem to the front desk -- despite the hotel guidelines saying that the concierge was in charge of the business center. What gives? Talk about a waste of money in having a useless concierge function at your hotel. Amateurs. As far as location, this place is hard to beat. But stay in a high floor on the back side of the hotel unless you want the noise. I do recommend this hotel, it is very expensive anywhere on Times Square -- just go with lower expectations. And bring a lot of cash or wiggle room on your credit card. The bar staff is good but again, the offers are very expensive. Oh yea, the rooms are ok. The 2 beds take up almost the entire room; but we warned: you can hear the other people in the connecting room clearly in their conversations and during their other necessary and sometimes unnecessary functions. Also, the heating system operates either straight on or off in high, medium or low and unless you had the heat at about halfway -- it was sweaty and stifling. Outdoor temperaturs were in the low 20s F.
reviews.title: Great Location; Average Value

reviews.text: We had a couple issues with our stay at the Crowne Plaza. I understand it was a very busy time (Thanksgiving weekend) but after my complaint, the handling of it was utterly ridiculous. The coffee in our room was never replenished. One time, upon asking housekeeping for some, she replied "we put two in every room". This may seem pretty minor, but more is coming. The last morning of our stay, my mother ordered breakfast from a outside restaurant to be deliverd. She talked to front desk, more than one occasion, to make sure that it could be deliverd to our room. They said yes. This was a surprise from her. That morning, we get a call saying food was waiting downstairs. I go down, can not find it. I ask the help desk. They did not know where it is. I go back upstairs to call the contact number, from the restaurant, that my mother had given me. The delivery man was at the hotel waiting, I was told. I went back down. I saw security and they directed me to the man. He said that he had been waiting 30 minutes for me. I had only gotten the call 15 minutes before I found him.
reviews.title: Very Poor Customer Service

reviews.text: Upon checking out, we called 45 minutes ahead for someone to get our luggage. No one showed up. I went downstairs and asked the bell-boy desk. I am told they are on the way. I get my car from valet. My husband calls me and says he is still waiting. I ask again, I am told they are on the way. More time goes by, my husband comes down to get a luggage cart and is told he can not take it. The man tells him someone is on the way. Long story short, my husband and son begin to bring our bags down in two trips. This ended about a hour and 45 minutes from when I first called. I can not begin to tell you how many people we saw coming and going with luggage in that time. I called and complained the night we got home. I was told by Adam , they he would have Barry contact me as soon as possible. Days went by, I sent a email to Adam. I was again told that Barry was going to contact me. When he did, he said that he was going to add points to my Priority rewards card, enough for 1 free night at the CP or 2 free nights at Holiday Inn Express. Days went by, did not happen. I called Adam again with my Rewards number. Did not see the addition on my card? Emailed Adam again, his reply was that he was going to see that it was taken care of. It is January 31 and this problem was never rectified. Wow....they have terrible customer service. Do not say you are going to do something and do not bother doing it. When I called initially, I was expecting anything, I just wanted them to be aware that this happened. He should not of offered a solution, if it was not going to be followed through. They DO NOT treat all customers the same. We are a military family, on a budget, that used our government discount. If we were paying $1000. for a deluxe room, rather than $400 for a standard, I can bet you, our luggage would have been carried down. Our business was not even important enough for a call back. Thank you guest service management at CP!!!
reviews.title: Fenomenal hotel

reviews.text: Extremely confortable and cozy rooms, excellent location, quiet, very nice staff (specially the concierge). Just the internet price was too expensive and restaurant was not very good. I´ll stay there again for sure.
reviews.title: Great location fab hotel !!!!

reviews.text: The Hotel was in a great location in the middle of times square if you like it busy then this is the place to be . New York is the busiest city we have ever been to a bit overwelming . We had gone for my daughters wedding in central park what a day it was fantastic !!!! we did all the sights Empire State , Rockefeller Centre ( worth a visit ) We did statue of liberty on a cruise round the harbour FANTASTIC !!! The hotel was great to come back to at night after a long day very luxurious and the comfiest bed ever . Dont forget to visit Ground Zero its very moving !!! Take the bus tours aswell well worth the money and you see all NEW YORK !!!!
reviews.title: AMAZING hotel..BEST beds!

reviews.text: location is everything about this Hotel, but also it's clean, modern and friendly staff. I stopped in nY for 24hrs on my way home and this hotel fitted the bill perfectly. Will be going back in Novemebr with family and have already booked again.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location
Loved it!
reviews.text: it's big and busy so if you like personal service forget it, but if central location and cleanliness is your thing then this is spot on. Rooms were recently refurbished and surprisingly big for central NY.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a fantastic, recently renovated hotel. For half of what some hotels in the area were, we got a room that was attractive, clean and quite sizable. The bathroom was immaculate. The bed was really comfortable. The staff was really nice, especially at the hotel bar where we enjoyed a great bottle of wine after a looooong day of trekking around NYC and taking in a Yankees vs. Red Sox game. And you couldn't beat the location... in Times Square close to TONS of stores, eateries and subway stations. I would stay in this hotel any visit to NYC.
reviews.title: just perfect, slept like a log!!

reviews.text: My husband and I spent 5 nights at the Crowne Plaza & chose this hotel after alot of research, we were not dissapointed.
reviews.title: THE CROWNE PLAZA DESERVES ITS CROWNE!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived in the afternoon and checked in, the room was ready right away and they put us facing times square and high up, as requested.
reviews.title: Great Hotel right in the heart of NYC

reviews.text: The CP Times Square sits in a great location, in the heart of Times Square. The rooms are a large size with great beds and bathroom facilities. We really enjoyed staying here and would recommend it. The best thing about the hotel is the location and room size. The worst thing was the attitude of the reception staff - generally rude. Its worth paying a little more to stay here!
reviews.title: Great rooms , great location

reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights 2 adults and 2 kids 13 and 16 years in a family room. Great view to Hudson River and a tiny view of Time square as well. Lifts available when needed, no lines. Good service with luggage. Helpful and caring staff. Rooms were up to date and tasty. Nice places to eat in the neighborhood.
reviews.title: Exelent location and functional Hotel

reviews.text: I stayed here for 3 nights from 2nd May to 5th May and other than a small bathtub i have no other complaints about this hotel..one morning i woke up and the water was cold so i rung reception and they sent someone straight up who fixed the problem straight away.. The location is great, the restaurant serves great food with great friendly waiters, the coffee bar is great for breakfast, the rooms were very clean and the hotel was in an awesome location especially if like myself you are going to see a show on braodway.. I travelled to New York on my own for business and i felt extremely safe and secure at this hotel. I would definately recommend it..
reviews.title: Great Restaurant, Coffee Shop and Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this hotel through Expedia and got a great deal !.. I travel to manhattan often and like to stay in times square and believe me this was it!
reviews.title: Location!!!

reviews.text: Hotel is right in times square above the Heashey Chocolate store. Very safe hotel security asked to see room keys each time we entered the hotel.. immaculate rooms & a good size for NYC standards. There is a good size bar and a amazing breakfast Buffett in the restaurant. although you are in times square rooms are soundproof!.. Very quiet and we had a corner suite facing times square . I defiantly would book this hotel again great location for a romantic getaway or a family vacation!
reviews.title: Great Hotel and great staff in an amazing location

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at The Crowne Plaza for my first trip to NYC. It's literally in the heart of the city and where all the action is. It's within walking distance to all of the broadway attractions, and any restaurant you can think of. Our room was very clean, and the staff at the front desk were friendly and attentive. We asked to change rooms because our original room was too close to the elevator which would have likely kept us up all night, as we're light sleepers. The staff gave us another room far from the elevator which was just as nice as the first room. We noticed the rooms were spacious ad clean, an provided a wonderful view of the city. It was so quiet in the room, it was difficult to believe we were so close to Times Square. It took us just five minutes to walk to a Broadway show. And just ten minutes to the subway station, or Central Park. We will definitely stay here again, and would highly recommend to anyone looking for a great location to stay while in NYC.
reviews.title: Fantastic location, helpful friendly staff, and clean rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiancee and I were celebrating our 5 year anniversary and decided to book a hotel room in the city and the Crowne Palaza looked like a good choice. Upon checking in we were greeted by the Lobby Manager Leo and he asked what brought us to the hotel that day. We explained that it was our 5 year anniversary and we wanted to just relax and enjoy our evening. He congratulated us and sent up a bottle of champaign to our room - this made our night! The room was beautiful and the view was terrific! I would absolutely go back!
reviews.title: Great staff and Service, Excellent Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were in this hotel for Valentines Day.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel in Fabulous Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I cannot recommend it highly enough.
reviews.title: Excellent location, room & staff....helped to make a memorable weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we checked in they only had a double room - which had 2 double beds. As we are used to sleeping in king size bed, we asked to be moved the next day. This was no problem at all - and they even moved our bags for us when we went out for the day.
reviews.title: Great Holiday experience

reviews.text: I stayed with my husband and two teen-children. We got a great rate as my husband is active duty military. I was disappointed that we were unable to get a roll away, as we requested. We were told that due to fire restrictions we couldn't have one. So one the kids took turns sleeping on the floor, we have one boy and one girl. The pool is strickly a lap pool, so not for "family fun or cool off". Our room was an older room and not recently updated, had to ask for additional towels, they only had enough for two people. Food in resturant was good but pricey, besides you have so many choices-go out. The services was great in the hotel, staff was friendly and helpful. House keeping services were also good.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: We travelled with friends to New York for Christmas shopping and stayed at this hotel. We had rooms (King Bed Deluxe) on one of the club floors (43-46). My wife are loyality club members and automatically qualified for rooms on this floor. We both had lovely rooms, however our friends were in 4302 (a corner room) which afforded them fantastic views of Times Square and the Hudson River. The views from our room were not as good. My wife and I are Intercontinental Hotels loyality club members and therefore qualified for the rooms on these level automatically (I think). The club levels gives you access to a lounge on the 44 th floor where you get a free continental breakfast, and soft drinks early evening. I thought the hotel was fantastic because of where itis. To be in Times Square with the theatres etc being so close is just unbelievable. The Metro is close and a number of the tourist sites are within walking distance.
reviews.title: Great Location - Room with good views is 4302

reviews.text: AREAS of CAUTION
reviews.title: Perfect tourist location

reviews.text: ROOMS - I have read a number of the reviews re rooms - our rooms were great, no complaints, however a friend has stayed at the hotel and was given a poor room. I think it is a case of you get what you pay. At the time we visited the rate was around $500 (that was reduced as well). Someone has written a review saying they got a room vis Priceline for $200 at the same time, but it was old, in need of decoration, small etc etc - as I have said you get what you paid forpay for w and small nn reviewed, and therefo. CONCIERGE - The concierge at the hotel is out sourced and though very helpful is very very expensive - I had theatre tickets but it was quite apparent that they were charging over the top for theatre tickets. The airport car service arrived on time but again was very expensive - there are always yellow cabs outside the hotel.

reviews.text: BILL - Check your bill via the television - we had a charge which took three calls or visits to get it removed.

Best Place In The World ....Ever!
reviews.text: The room seemed as if it had been recently refurbished. It was clean and in great condition. My only gripe would be a preference for a bath rather than a shower, but this is a minor thing and in no way would prevent me from staying in this hotel again.

reviews.text: The other gripe is with the swimming pool. It is a great, but I do not really wish to have a mandatory bathing hat.

reviews.text: Staff were friendly and helpful, and I discovered the free internet access (first ten minutes are free) and this useful. The concierge was very helpful and found me a store I'd be looking for.
reviews.title: WICKED was fantastic !!!

reviews.text: Hotel was comfortable and experience was as good as the last time. I was able to secure a late check out (2pm) and was given a nice high room.
reviews.title: Another good stay.

reviews.text: The only negative aspects to the hotel was the air con in the room did not work well. Although it was March, the room was surprisingly warm and I could not get cool air to come through the vent. However this may have been a local fault and I should have really phoned reception to sort it (It really wasn't that bad).
reviews.title: Clean, friendly, awesome location and excellent food
HAPPY NEW YEAR
reviews.text: The second negative aspect was no free internet access in the business lounge. This is not good. Budget hotels including Holiday Inn Express offer this service, so not sure why the Crowne Plaza cannot. Otherwise the experience was excellent. The room had 2 double beds an immaculate bathroom with a bath and the room was a decent size on the 39th Floor. There was a large LCD TV with lots of channels that I was able to hook my portable DVD player to. Room service was reasonably priced with a wide selection of food. Location is great just to the North of the Centre of Times Square. There are 2 subway stations within 2 minutes of the hotel (49th St on the N-R Line and 50th St on the 1 Local train line). There is a large pool and gym (which I did not use). I have lost my Platinum status of Priority club (owing to not getting enough points in 2010) which meant loss of access to the top floor lounge where complimentary drinks and snacks are served.

reviews.title: Average Hotel
reviews.text: The staff were very friendly and helpful and the bar area lively and well used. I would definetly recommend this hotel to any one who wishes to visit NYC. Location wise, you will struggle to beat this.
I will definetly stay here again, and hope to get a room with a view of Times Square next time.
reviews.title: Great Location - Beyond Poor in every other aspect
Broadway Bound

reviews.title: Enjoyed great service and amenities at an unbeatable location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My colleague thoroughly enjoyed our time at the Crowne Plaze Times Square during a recent conference in New York. In the midst of the harsh winter weather, this hotel offered a nice haven. It's conveniently located to many restaurants theaters. Hector, the door man, is quite an asset to the hotel, always offering a smile and a nod with very helpful assistance on nearby restaurants.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel, shame about the elevator noise

reviews.text: We chose this hotel because of its location basically on Times Square, and we were not disappointed. Its central for everything. I was initially worried that the noise from Times Square would keep us awake, but on the 36th floor, you could only hear the odd sirens whizzing past. We had a panoramic view room which was 36, 02. The room was gorgeous, really big and comfortable. As previously stated on other reviews, the noise from the elevators is awful, even though we were 5 or 6 rooms down, you could still hear it all night and early morning, this was the only downside, but because we had walked for miles, our tiredness took over and we were able to sleep. I suppose the view from the room made us stay and not complain.
reviews.title: Customer service was horrible! Hotel cancelled our reservations!

reviews.text: There is a fitness suite with swimming pool - however if you are not in the priority club, they charge $10 a day, which I found disappointing as we had already paid for 4 nights at the hotel. The pool is ok, but split into 4 lanes and gets very busy, so basically you end up having to share a lane with someone and no room to swim !
reviews.title: Beware of elevator noise in tower rooms ending in 02

reviews.text: Stayed 6 nIghts. Great value considering location and size of room. So close to shows. Only drawback was noise from slamming doors in hallway. Other than that was perfect.
reviews.title: Time square jewel

reviews.text: I traveled to NYC on business and stayed at the Crowne Plaza Times Square for the first time on this trip. Although I have stayed at many Crowne Plaza Hotels, this specific location really wow'd me!
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Excellent Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything was very clean and the hotel staff was nice, as I expect a Crowne Plaza to be. There was an issue with the heat in my room, it was too hot for me at 68 degrees. The staff was able to fix the temperature, but the front desk also sent a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries to my room while I was away. I was very surprised by this and it was a very nice gesture.
reviews.title: Very Good Hotel in an Excellent Location

reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel. The location is perfect (although we knew that before we went) as you are a few paces from the steps on Times Square. The room, the food, the service, the bell-boys were extremely good and the concierge service was superb. We had a big problem when we arrived in that our safe didn't work - this meant that we couldn't unpack (in case they were to move us to another room), we couldn't sleep (which is all we wanted to do after only 3 hrs sleep in 45!) as we didn't know it would be a three hour wait and we couldn't shower as we couldn't unpack. After 3 hours of complaining and being fobbed off, my girlfriend finally let ME speak to manager. He was extremely helpful, fully of apologies, got the safe fixed within minutes and gave us free food & drink in the restaurant and two free breakfasts. The restaurant is very nice and his reaction more than made up for the error. Generally New York is an exciting place to be! I thoroughly recommend the water taxi, the hard rock cafe & Langham's Irish Bar in west 47th street!! I would definitely stay at this hotel the next time I visit New York and I recommend it (make sure you use the excellent concierge service!)
reviews.title: Great location, comfortable rooms, friendly and helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I chose the hotel based on location and reviews on this site, and am so glad I did. It came to a choice between the Crowne Plaza, the Millennium Broadway and the Hilton, and I think I made the right choice. The location is just perfect, right on Times Sq so you can walk most places and have a great view.

reviews.text: Stayed at the Crowne Plaza with my mother for a weekend getaway. The Hotel is in a great location right in the middle of Times Square. The room was huge we had at great view of Times Square we stayed in room 1401. We had no problem checking in the breakfast buffet is very expensive but we both were given a complenmentary breakfast for one morning. The bellman was very helpful in getting us a cab each day and the hotel employees was very nice. I have been to New York severl times but now I have a new place to stay.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel
Comfortable Stay
reviews.text: We were at the Crowne Plaza Manhattan Hotel in mid April 2006. It was a comforable stay in the midst of the Theater District/Times Square. We could not have asked for a better location, as we were more interested in the Art Museums. The taxi fares were very reasonable, much the same as Chicago taxi fares. Our NYC Taxi drivers were great. The food in NYC is expensive if you are on a budget, not less than $14.00 for a sandwich/lunch meal at Roxy's Deli, unless you go to McD's-which you don't want to do, unless it is for a quick soda. Roxy's Deli on Broadway at about 47th St - serves large portions of food & will hold your food for you while at the Theater to pick up later that night to take back to your room for a late night snack. I think they are open till 2:00am. Central Park was beautiful this Spring. We were able to park our car near the Googenheim Museum in a Parking Garage for approx 5 hrs for $30.00 - not bad for NYC. Back to our hotel room: we were on the 16th floor - non-smoking room that was adequate size - the bathroom was a great size - always had hot water & I could not believe how cold the cold water was in this hotel - it was like it was out of the refrigerator and it was 70+ degrees outside. The king mattress was new & wonderfully comfortable & several pillows. We saw no bed bugs like NBC or CNN had reported for this hotel. In their on-site news report they did not find any bed bugs either, in this hotel, after the lady had reported them. Evidently, this hotel was on top of it. If the bed bugs were there at one time, they had been irradicated. One thing nice during the Spring season when the hotel does not use heat or air conditioning, this hotel's windows open a few inches so you can get cooler air in your room at night. I thought this a plus. The hotel's Samplings Restaurant was nice, however, watch your bill, if you charge it to your room. They doubled charged us for our breakfast one morning. The hotel desk clerk took off the extra charge without any problem since I had a copy of our receipt - so keep your meal receipts unless you do not care. The room was clean except for a few spots on the lower part of the curtains, cleanliness - about a 8 or 9 out of 10 being the best. The hotel staff were very helpful, efficient and friendly. We had a great stay & would stay at this hotel again.
Where do I begin? This hotel is a joke. The location's alright and the room's are OK (despite having the worst AC I've ever seen and no mini bar), but the service is literally awful.
reviews.title: The worst service I have ever encountered
Beware bed bugs?
reviews.text: I have stayed in a lot of hotels in my time, from 5* to $2 a night guest houses when I was gap year student travelling and not once have I come across such incredibly poor levels of service.

The front desk staff are stunningly incompetent and rude, I saw several other guests visibly shocked and angered by their 'talk-to-the-hand-cos-the-face-ain't-listening' attitude - this is after all a hotel that has the audacity to charge a $660 per night rack-rate for a double room.
reviews.title: Room, fine; service, terrible

reviews.text: I've stayed at this hotel four or five times due to its location, and there are a lot of good things about it. But right now, I am so flabbergasted and angry at having just learned that I would have to pay $14.95 a night for Wi Fi that it makes all of the good things pale in comparison. At around $300 a night, I'd like to think they could offer Wi Fi free of charge to their guests... especially in this day and age, when even the economy-class hotels and motels do so. Very disappointing, and I will explore other options for my next trip to NY in August.
reviews.title: $14.95 a day for Wi Fi?

reviews.text: Hey, I travelled to NYC at least 15 times a year over the last four years as I came to visit my kd in a NYC college. I wish I had discovered the Crowne Plaza in Times Square sooner than my kid's senior year. The place is fantastic. Comfortable beds. A very helpful staff. Taxis always there at the ready for a quick ride uptown. A superb dining facility inside the hotel makes evening arrangements easy after a long day out in the city on your feet. No only that, you can literally throw a stone at three or four theaters right there which are featuring excellent musicals and drama. The rates? They seem to compare favorably with the other places nearby; however, I did find a few hotels out in NJ for less and a few about 25 miles outside the city (byt still in NY state) for less. Looking back on it, waking up in the city that never sleeps and looking out the window at Times Square to see activity at 3 am--priceless.
reviews.title: Best night I ever spent in NYC

reviews.text: I would stay there again in a heart-beat.
reviews.title: Very Expensive! Great Hotel and Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Travelled here for 6 days, fantastic location!
reviews.title: Amazing hotel in the heart of broadway

reviews.text: Hotel was clean and very lush! Excellent service received from all the staff. The bar was a bit on the expensive side but there is a shop about 100 yards away what sells cold drinks which we took back to our room!
reviews.title: Crown Plaza New York - Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the 2nd time in 2 years that we've stayed at this very well managed hotel. The rooms are clean, modern, large for NYC, and very well planned. There were outlets everywhere, including in the table lamps. There was all the amenities you possibly would want and even the pillows offered everything from firm to soft so you have choices. The thermostat was new and allowed for great temperature control. The best part was the staff. From front desk, to the Brasserie and doormen, they all were the most impressive that I've ever seen anywhere in the world. The way they wanted you to know they were there to help, to take care of you, and to go out of their way to deliver service showed just how proud they each were to be there. I don't know how literally every staff member in such a large hotel can be so friendly, but they were. The only complaint was that the wait for elevators on our floor was anywhere from 5 minutes to 15 minutes. A doorman told us at least one was down when I asked but that it had been repaired. However, the hotel made up for it when there was a charge for the bar that wasn't ours and they took it off at checkout without any questions asked. We thought this was going to be a call to our credit card company to get this take off but true to the superb customer service, there was no such need to do so. The Brasserie restaurant food is also one of the best placed to dine anywhere in Times Square (which is not where the really good restaurants are in NYC) and does not disappoint. We'll keep coming back on every NYC visit.
reviews.title: The best service of any hotel - Period!
Ideal location
reviews.text: Stayed for 5 nights in May, liked the room, massive with a comfortable bed and clean well equipped bathroom but the bathtub looked "tired" and could have done with replacing.Our room was on 36th floor and overlooked Time Square . Didn't eat at the hotel, the only the I can criticise is that the bar was very very expensive, $70 for 4 drinks including tip and also it had no atmosphere. Other than that would recommend the hotel

I have stayed at this hotel prior to the recent Multi million $ refurbishment. The rooms are big for New york standards. We checked in and the receptionist was very helpful and polite and a real credit to the IHG chain. We are Platinum members and were given access to the Club lounge each morning for free breakfast. Definately an added bonus. This seems to be automatic and I was impressed.
reviews.title: Great staff on reception and good customer service

reviews.text: The room was lovely modern and excellent quality. We had 2 double beds. The location of the hotel in times square is great. It was Feb and NYC was quite warm which is unusual. We never ate in the hotel but I did have a few drinks in the nice lobby bar. It was very busy but the staff were very attentive.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, especially for business.

reviews.text: The room had a safe and unfortunately this was locked shut in the middle of our trip. It had broken. The hotel sent someone to fix it who didn't have the best attitude. Then another man who drilled open the safe. I complained to reception and I would say they were fantastic at guest relations. They arranged for me to use the safe in reception free of charge and the manager was apologetic and gave me 35000 priority points as an apology. I had been waiting round for 3 hours though for them to fix the safe not what you need on a vacation.
reviews.title: Ho hum!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Crowne Plaza is quite nice and the location is absolutely fabulous. We generally visit Manhattan 2-3 weekends per year, stay in Times Square and pay $200-$250 per night. We’ve been happy with the hotels we’ve chosen over the years, but feel that this one is a little better for the price. We booked directly with Crowne Plaza on line and had a King Superior room at $249 over Labor Day Weekend 9/2/06. Some of the hotels we stayed in before would not allow us to book for just one night over the holiday weekend. The room was spacious, very clean, nicely appointed, like new and very peaceful. We actually slept late! We seldom do that. One very minor complaint I have is they could use better ventilation in the bathrooms to keep the mirrors from fogging. The staff was friendly and accommodating. They changed our room upon request (excessively noisy children next door to the first room). Elevator service was great and security seemed decent. They required all to show a room key before entering at night. The lobby was nice and we got to enjoy some live piano music there.
reviews.title: Quite Nice
Great hotel and great location
reviews.text: Our stay was short, but excellent. We will definitely return if we can find similar rates here in the future.

This a very busy hotel but great at the same time. We stayed over weekend of 2/9/06 and initially we were disappointed as the double room we were given was not great and had some bits of wallpaper peeling off, view of air conditioner, looked like it needed spruced up and also there were 2 smallish beds so( as it was my birthday treat) we told the reception that we were not completely happy and he changed our room with no problem or charge to a fantastic kingsize room on 40th floor with views over broadway. The bed was huge and very comfortable very cool or warm if needed as we had one day of torrential rain. The bar was very nice for a late drink and all staff pleasant except for one of the concierges who insisted very loudly that the cheapest way to Newark airport (from city to airport) was a yellow cab at approx $75 plus toll plus tip. He said we had to listen to him as he had 20 years experience however we had been told previously not to take a yellow cab back so I enquired with a private hire and got a lovely car to travel in and it cost $48 plus $8 toll plus tip. Yellow cab is fine for getting from the airport. Had a great time in New York.
reviews.title: Ok but not great!

reviews.text: My Fiance contacted the hotel to say that we had booked a Deluxe room and wanted to ask if possible we could have a broadway view. They replied that they would arrange it for us and also send up a bottle of wine and cheese and crackers. Also received a second email confirming our request would be granted as it was enough in advance and as it was my birthday.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel right in the heart of NYC!!

reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel only to be told that there were no broadway rooms left but that we could get an upgrade to a Harbour view room. We said ok an upgrade must be good, NO we got the exact same room we paid for. My Fiance went back to reception to say that we would take any room even two singles if we could have a good view. They said they would contact us that evening or the following morning to tell us when we could move rooms. The call or message never ever came. Our room had a view of an office block and a rentals building not the harbour!! The wine and crackers never arrived either just a birthday card.
reviews.title: crown in times square

aka: Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan Hotel New York City
description: Times Square, always New York's most exciting scene, seems all new now that the Crowne Plaza Times Square has reinvented itself. Come check out our $85 million re-invention, and see for yourself how modern design can provide a whole new kind of comfort. Enjoy one of our 795 well-appointed guest rooms outfitted with fresh contemporary accents and plush Sleep Advantage beds. Every room offers breathtaking views of Times Square, the famous Manhattan skyline or the Hudson River, unique among hotels in Times Square. Relax in our sleek lobby lounge, or have an evening cocktail in Broadway 49 Bar. Delight in a new spin on New American Eclectic cuisine at Brasserie 1605, one of the most exciting Times Square restaurants. With options like these, it's no wonder that New York seems so new. If you ve come for a meeting, you ll benefit from the new tech-friendly environment. If you re here for an event, you ll revel in the open space and atmospheric lighting, and when you walk through our front door, you step onto Broadway dazzling lights, world-class entertainment and urban energy. That's how Crowne Plaza Times Square is keeping New York new for you.
